caption.p: The t-SNE algorithm attempts to find the optimal map of high-dimensional data into a low-dimensional space while preserving the distances among points as much as possible. Thus, the distance between pair of viruses or virus clades (labelled by the same abbreviations as Figure 4) is approximately proportional to their mean kernel distance. Groups of virus clades of particular interest are highlighted with the corresponding colours: HIV, red; HCV, yellow; Dengue (DEN), green; IAV-H3, IAV-H1, and IBV (blue).
